author: @eldeber
title: Arsenal cae 2-0 en casa ante West Ham, mientras el Liverpool sigue líder | El Deber
text: Fútbol INGLATERRA Arsenal cae 2-0 en casa ante West Ham, mientras el Liverpool sigue líder Relevo en el liderato de la Premier League: el Arsenal se vio sorprendido en su estadio al caer 2-0 ante su vecino West Ham, este jueves en el partido que cerró la 19ª jornada, donde no pudo retener el liderato. El checo Tomas Soucek (minuto 13) y el griego Konstantinos Mavropanos (55) firmaron esta victoria del West Ham bajo la lluvia en el Emirates Stadium. Los 'Gunners' se quedan con 40 puntos, a dos del Liverpool (42), que en el 'Boxing Day' del martes había ganado 2-0 en el terreno del modesto Burnley (19º) y se había colocado en cabeza provisionalmente. La derrota del Arsenal ante los 'Hammers' hace que el liderato de los pupilos de Jürgen Klopp sea ya en firme, al menos hasta la siguiente jornada, que arranca el sábado. Precisamente, el Arsenal había mantenido el liderato el pasado domingo con un empate 1-1 en el campo del Liverpool. Esta vez tuvo que claudicar en su objetivo ante un West Ham (6º) en puestos europeos. Respecto a otros perseguidores, el Arsenal sigue un punto por delante del Aston Villa (3º), que perdió el martes 3-2 en el campo del Manchester United, pero ve acercarse a tres puntos al Manchester City (4º), que el miércoles ganó 3-1 en el campo del Everton (17º) y que tiene además un partido disputado menos que el resto de formaciones de la parte alta de la clasificación. El Tottenham (5º), que fue derrotado 4-2 en el campo del Brighton (8º) este jueves, es otro de los perdedores de esta jornada al salir de la 'zona Champions' y quedar ahora a seis puntos del líder Liverpool.

author: Caleb Nguyen
title: Woods Humane Society announces St. Pet-rick’s adoption weekend
text: The Woods Humane Society (Woods) reduced its adoption fees for all animals to just $70 to celebrate St. Patrick's Day weekend. The promotion will begin on March 15 and run through March 17 as several dogs, cats, puppies and kittens all seek new homes for the spring. Woods CEO Emily L'Heureux stated the importance of finding these animals homes at this time of year. “Not only is St. Patrick’s Day this weekend, but mid-March is also the time of year when we start to field increasing requests to shelter puppies and kittens as baby season gets underway,” said L’Heureux. “Our hope is that this fun event will help our dogs, cats, puppies and kittens find some good luck and a loving family, while also helping us make room for the many animals still in need of our care.” All adoptable animals have been given proper medical treatment and adoptions will have a month of pet insurance with a free check-up at a local vet clinic. For more information about Woods you can visit the website or call [805-543-9316.](tel:8055439316)

author: Javier Nomdedeu
title: L'Alcora quita el nombre de una calle dedicada a un religioso pederasta
text: [L’Alcora](https://www.elperiodicomediterraneo.com/castello/lalcora/) quitará el nombre de la calle Hermano Gaspar y la renombrará como Dels Educadors tras los casos de [pederastia](https://www.elperiodicomediterraneo.com/tags/pederastia/) y [abusos sexuales](https://www.elperiodicomediterraneo.com/tags/abusos-sexuales/) de los que está acusado este religioso. Lo aprobó este jueves el [pleno](https://www.elperiodicomediterraneo.com/tags/pleno/) por unanimidad durante la última sesión del año. La investigación que ordenó el [papa Francisco](https://www.elperiodicomediterraneo.com/tags/papa-francisco/) después de endurecer las leyes contra los abusos y reformar el Código de Derecho Canónico en el 2021 llegó a la capital de l’ [Alcalatén](https://www.elperiodicomediterraneo.com/tags/l-alcalaten/) para analizar los hechos ocurridos entre 1970 y 1971. Suicidio de su sobrina Un sobrino del clérigo de La Salle Gaspar Espinilla Martín, que ejercía como profesor en el [colegio](https://www.elperiodicomediterraneo.com/tags/colegios/), denunció que su hermana sufrió abusos de su tío, algunos de ellos un verano en el que fueron invitados por este religioso al centro alcorino donde estaba destinado. Además, su sobrino relata que en la adolescencia su hermana contó a su madre (era la cuñada de Espinilla) este escándalo sexual, que derivó en su suicidio, pero quedó todo callado, sin denunciarlo. En 1990, bajo la alcaldía de Vicente Sanz Juan y a instancia de la dirección del colegio La Salle de l’Alcora y los presidentes de las asociaciones de padres y la de antiguos [alumnos](https://www.elperiodicomediterraneo.com/tags/alumnos/), solicitaron en el pleno asignar una calle a este religioso, que estuvo más de 30 años ejerciendo como docente en l’Alcora. No contó nunca con ninguna queja ni [denuncia](https://www.elperiodicomediterraneo.com/tags/denuncia/), todo lo contrario, ya que era muy apreciado en la localidad. El Ayuntamiento dio luz verde a esta petición y le dedicó la calle colindante a la vivienda de los lasalianos del colegio. Es un vial público empinado con escalinata que conecta la plaza La Salle con la calle José Mascarós Pallarés. El hermano Gaspar Espinilla nació en 1914 en Medina de Rioseco (Valladolid) y falleció a los 93 años (en 2007) en la residencia que tiene La Salle en Pont d’Inca ( [Mallorca](https://www.elperiodicomediterraneo.com/tags/mallorca/)). Trayectoria del centro Este capítulo no empaña la admirable trayectoria humanitaria y educativa del colegio La Salle, con casi 100 años de presencia en l’Alcora (data de 1929), pues es uno de los centros educativos referentes y más concurridos y estimados de la capital de l’Alcalatén, hasta el punto de haber recibido numerosos homenajes y de tener también una plaza dedicada a su fundador San Juan Bautista de La Salle. En la actualidad, solo quedan tres hermanos de las escuelas cristianas de La Salle en el colegio de l’Alcora, aunque están [jubilados](https://www.elperiodicomediterraneo.com/tags/jubilados/) y no ejercen como docentes, de modo que el centro está dirigido por [profesores](https://www.elperiodicomediterraneo.com/tags/profesores/) de carácter civil.

author: Nathanaël Jacqmin
title: La variole du singe, c'est grave docteur? - L'Avenir
text: La variole du singe, c'est grave docteur? La variole du singe est une maladie qui effraye. L'OMS, en déclenchant son plus haut niveau d'alerte sanitaire au niveau international, a créé un vent de panique. Et les rumeurs se répandent bien plus vite que le virus. [Nathanaël Jacqmin](/journaliste/nathanael-jacqmin-EK553TZBTJBZNKZ5IWX2NDQPFM/)Rédacteur en chef-adjoint - Editeur - Responsable Deuzio, suppléments et produits spéciaux - Publié le 15-08-2024 à 22h47 - Mis à jour le 16-08-2024 à 08h15 La propagation rapide du mpox (variole du singe) en Afrique préoccupe l'OMS, qui a réuni son comité d'urgence et [déclenché mercredi son plus haut niveau d'alerte sanitaire au niveau international. ](https://www.lavenir.net/actu/monde/2024/08/15/variole-du-singe-loms-declenche-son-plus-haut-niveau-dalerte-mondiale-XFOAJOZAJBBL5BIXNPCDMTWRKY/)Grave Docteur? En Afrique, certainement. Si 38 465 cas ont été recensés dans 16 pays africains depuis janvier 2022 (dont 1 456 décès) on note une augmentation de 160 % des cas en 2024 selon des données publiées la semaine dernière par l'agence de santé Africa CDC (548 morts depuis le début de l'année). Des chiffres sous-estimés dans les régions reculées de ces pays où, malheureusement, la prise en charge médicale des patients est très difficile.

author: Basketball-With-New-Balan
title: The Making of a Legend: Vitor Roque's Inspirational Journey from Brazil to Barcelona
text:
Vitor Roque: A Rising Celebrity Joins Barcelona's Ranks Ziatogel
In a revolutionary move, Vitor Roque, the 18-year-old Brazilian demonstrator, has formally joined Barcelona, signing a seven-and-a-half-year bargain that prolongs till June 2031. This exciting purchase marks a considerable phase in Roque's appealing job, having currently made a substantial effect in his indigenous Brazil.
Arrival in Spain:
Vitor Roque's arrival in Spain declares a brand-new era for Barcelona. The young skill has actually started a trip to boost his profession on the La Liga phase, leaving an indelible mark on football lovers worldwide.
Remarkable Career Highlights:
Despite his youth, Roque has an impressive record, advancing via the ranks at Atletico Mineiro and Cruzeiro. His senior launching at Cruzeiro at simply 16 showcased his phenomenal abilities, establishing the phase for a stellar profession.
Athletico Paranaense Stint:
Roque's relocate to Athletico Paranaense in April 2022, for a club-record fee of just under ₤ 4 million, indicated a brand-new
situs slot phase. He rapidly established himself, gaining a place in the Copa Libertadores Team of the Tournament, a testament to his prowess on the area.
Success in 2023:
The 2022/23 period was monumental for Roque, contributing substantially to Athletico's success. With 21 objectives and eight assists in 45 appearances, he played an essential duty in safeguarding Athletico's first state championship in 3 years.
International Recognition:
Roque's journey included the worldwide phase, standing for Brazil in numerous capacities. His debut for the senior team in a friendly versus Morocco highlighted his capacity, and he became the joint leading marker in the Under-20 South American Championship.
Barcelona's Statement Signing:
Barcelona's decision to secure Roque's services underscores their commitment to nurturing emerging skill. The demonstrator's EUR500 million launch condition stresses the club's idea in his future payments.
Xavi's Ambitions:
Vitor Roque signs up with Barcelona at a crucial juncture in the season, with the team currently sitting fourth in the La Liga table. As Xavi's side navigates the challenges ahead, Roque's addition injects fresh energy and guarantee.
Looking Ahead:
As Roque works out into his new function at Barcelona, football lovers eagerly expect seeing the young striker's growth and influence on the pitch. The extended contract until 2031 signals a long-term commitment, creating a feeling of exhilaration and expectancy wherefore exists in advance.

author: 陈子琰
title: July temperatures set national record - Chinadaily.com.cn
text:
China experienced its hottest month on record in July, with the highest average temperature since the country began releasing comprehensive data in 1961, the China Meteorological Administration said on Thursday.
Jia Xiaolong, deputy director of the National Climate Center, said the national average temperature hit a record 23.2 C last month, 1.1 C higher than in the previous hottest July dating back to 1961.
"In July, China encountered a combination of extreme heavy rainfall and extreme high temperatures nationwide," Jia said at a news conference in Beijing.
Southern China faced a widespread and prolonged heat wave in July, with multiple regions experiencing continuous high temperatures for over 20 days.
A total of 59 national meteorological stations recorded daily maximum temperatures that broke or hit historical records.
Temperatures above 41 C were observed in places like Cili in Hunan province, Tongshan in Hubei province and Lishui in Zhejiang province, Jia said.
Hot weather records were shattered around the world last month, with July 22 being Earth's hottest day on record as the global daily average temperature reached 17.15 C.
The sudden rise in average daily temperature from July 21 to 22 was mainly due to significantly higher than average temperatures in the Northern Hemisphere, particularly in North America and Europe, as well as most of Antarctica, Jia said.
According to forecasts, temperatures in most parts of China will remain higher than usual this month.
Two significant heat waves will hit in the first half of August, and the high temperatures are expected to ease late in the month, the CMA said.
In July, national average precipitation was 140 millimeters, 15 percent more than in the same period in previous years and the third highest since 1961.
The previous two records, when the country was hit by catastrophic floods, were 148 mm in July 1996 and 146.8 mm in July 1998.
Frequent heavy rains battered a large expanse of China from north to south last month, with the provinces of Shandong and Jilin receiving their highest precipitation since 1961.
Daily precipitation records were broken at 33 national meteorological stations. Among them, Sheqi in Henan province, Hengshan in Hunan province and Pingyi in Shandong saw daily precipitation exceed 300 mm.
Jia said the rainy season in North China began on July 22, and on July 30 Beijing experienced its most intense rainfall since the start of flood season.
Local authorities urged extra efforts to prevent secondary disasters such as floods and landslides, he said.
A total of 2,492 red alerts were issued nationwide in July, an 84 percent increase compared to the average for the month in the previous seven years, he added. Two-thirds of the red alerts were for heavy rain.
zhaoyimeng@chinadaily.com.cn

author: Henry Turner
title: Tenaya Therapeutics Advances Gene Therapy for Heart Health
text: Tenaya Therapeutics Advances Gene Therapy for Heart Health [Henry Turner](https://investorshangout.com/profile/view?id=79353)Updated: 10-17-2024 04:56 PM Tenaya Therapeutics and Its Pioneering Gene Therapy Tenaya Therapeutics, Inc. (NASDAQ: TNYA), a biotech company dedicated to innovative treatments for heart diseases, is making remarkable progress with its MyPEAK-1 Phase 1b/2 clinical trial. This trial focuses on TN-201, a gene therapy that shows promise for treating MYBPC3-associated hypertrophic cardiomyopathy (HCM). Approval from the Data and Safety Monitoring Board The independent Data and Safety Monitoring Board (DSMB) has given a green light for the continuation of this clinical trial. They have recommended advancing to higher doses and expanding the eligibility criteria for participants. After successfully dosing the first group with 3E13 vg/kg, the tolerability profile matched that of other gene therapies at this level, with no unforeseen adverse effects. Consequently, the DSMB has approved an increase in dosage to 6E13 vg/kg, and enrollment for the following group of participants is currently underway. Investigation of TN-201's Efficacy The MyPEAK-1 study is designed to establish the safety of TN-201 and explore how it affects various patient populations by increasing MyBP-C protein levels, which are deficient in MYBPC3-associated HCM patients. The trial protocol has been adapted to include a baseline biopsy and broaden eligibility to include obstructive HCM patients, aiming for a total of 24 adult participants. Looking Ahead: Data and Insights Initial data from the first cohort is anticipated to be released soon, with findings expected to cover safety, tolerability, updates from cardiac biopsies, and alterations in cardiac biomarkers since the study's inception. The investigations also include information on TN-201’s influence on heart function, exercise capacity, overall functional status, and improvements in the quality of life for patients. Understanding the Challenges of Pediatric MYBPC3-Associated HCM Additionally, Tenaya has addressed the significant disease burden of pediatric MYBPC3-associated HCM. Presentations from the HCM Society Scientific Sessions indicated that 13% of the nearly 1,800 patients documented in the SHaRe database received their diagnosis before the age of 18, with 50% of these individuals facing major health complications by 40 years old. This urgency highlights the necessity for new genetic medicines that can substantially alter prognosis. Regulatory Designations and Future Studies Tenaya's TN-201 has garnered several critical designations from regulatory bodies, including Fast Track, Orphan Drug, and Rare Pediatric Drug Designations from the U.S. FDA, along with orphan medicinal product designation from the European Commission. The company is also actively researching pediatric MYBPC3-associated HCM through an ongoing natural history study called MyClimb. Market Performance and Financial Insights With the advances in its clinical programs, investors are keen to evaluate Tenaya Therapeutics (NASDAQ: TNYA) within the context of the market. The current market capitalization stands at approximately $168.03 million, reflecting Tenaya's position among small-cap biotechnology firms. Notably, Tenaya holds more cash than debt, which supports its ongoing research endeavors while providing financial flexibility. Challenges in Revenue Generation However, it is crucial to consider that the company is quickly using its cash reserves, as it has reported a significant operating loss in the past year. This is typical in early-stage biotech firms, where substantial investments are required for clinical development. Recent Stock Performance The company’s share price has witnessed significant fluctuation, with a recent total return of -51.92% in the last quarter. These variables are worth noting for any interested investors, as biotech stocks tend to exhibit volatility during critical phases like clinical trial updates and regulatory reviews. Frequently Asked Questions What is Tenaya Therapeutics focused on? Tenaya Therapeutics specializes in gene therapies aimed at treating heart diseases, specifically hypertrophic cardiomyopathy. What trial is Tenaya currently conducting? They are conducting the MyPEAK-1 Phase 1b/2 clinical trial to evaluate the safety and efficacy of TN-201. What are the recent developments in Tenaya's clinical trial? The trial has progressed to a higher dosage after securing approval from the Data and Safety Monitoring Board. How does TN-201 benefit patients with HCM? TN-201 aims to increase MyBP-C protein levels, which are crucial in treating patients with MYBPC3-associated HCM. What was the market response to Tenaya recently? Tenaya's stock has experienced volatility, with a notable decline, which reflects broader trends seen in biotech sectors during trial phases. author: Kantipur Media Group
title: Patience, passion and pastries
text: [Recipes ](/food/recipes) Patience, passion and pastries Celeus Baral, who runs the online bake shop Bakeleus, talks about how baking is similar to chemistry—and gives us easy recipes to try at home.[bookmark](javascript:;) [Anusha Dhakal](/author/anusha-dhakal) Celeus Baral exudes a serene aura when you meet her, and when she tells you she bakes, it makes sense. Even during a brief encounter, you can tell she has the patience needed to be a baker. “You can eyeball cooking, but baking is chemistry. You have to be meticulous. You cannot rush it, or it does not turn out as expected,” says the 21-year-old environment science student. She also runs the online baking shop Bakeleus. Recently, she has also started selling her baked goods beyond her online shop, with her first stall appearing at The Yellow House’s Night Market. Bakeleus’s menu lists a variety of offerings, including jams, granola, tarts, cakes, cookies, cupcakes and brownies. Baral began baking in 2020, during the lockdown, and launched her online shop last year. She grows much of the produce she incorporates into her baking, and believes we should all understand the origins of our food. “This connection fosters gratitude and a deeper appreciation for nature,” she says. Her background in environmental science, coupled with her affinity for the natural world, imbues her creations with a unique artistic sensibility. Each item she bakes is a testament to her creativity and experimentation, as she believes consistent practice is the key to mastery. Despite the demands of being a full-time student, Baral strives to accommodate orders, typically requiring a minimum of 72 hours' notice for delivery. She is a passionate and discerning individual, evident in the love she infuses into her baking. Additionally, Baral advocates for a zero-waste policy at home, ensuring that every scrap of food and all household items are recycled. Three easy to bake recipes you can try at home Mini carrot cakes Ingredients: 38 g milk or yoghurt 35 g all-purpose flour 1/4 tea spoon ground cinnamon 1/8 tea spoon ground ginger A pinch of cardamom 1 tea spoon baking powder ½ tea spoon fine sea salt 2 large eggs, at room temperature 27 g granulated sugar 13 g brown sugar (or 39 g of regular granulated sugar) 1 tea spoon vanilla extract 27 g extra virgin olive oil 33 g carrots, peeled and shredded Chopped walnuts Candied lemon or orange slices (optional for garnish) Cream cheese frosting 56.5 g unsalted butter, softened 113.5 g cream cheese, softened 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract A pinch of salt 250 g powdered sugar Directions: For the cake: Preheat the oven to 195°C. Line and grease 6-inch square inch pan. Whisk flour, cinnamon, ginger, cardamom, spices, baking powder and salt. Beat eggs, sugar and vanilla until fluffy. Gradually mix in oil and milk, then add the flour mixture and fold in the carrots and walnuts. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes and let it cool down. Then cut out circles. For the cream cheese frosting: Beat softened butter, then mix in powdered sugar, vanilla, lemon juice, and cream cheese until smooth. Chill the frosting for 30 minutes before using. Frost mini cakes and top with candied lemon slices. Instructions for frosting: In a mixing bowl, beat softened butter until smooth. Add cream cheese, vanilla extract, and a pinch of salt. Beat until well combined. Gradually add powdered sugar and beat until creamy and smooth. Use to frost the carrot cake however you desire! Mulberry fudge cake Ingredients: 2 eggs 100 g of sugar 50 g of butter 40 g of chocolate 120 ml of plain yogurt 60 g of flour 22.5 g of cocoa powder 1.25 g of baking powder 120 ml of frozen or fresh mulberries Directions: Preheat the oven at 180°C and start by creaming together the eggs and half of the sugar until frothy. Melt the butter and chocolate together and add into the egg mixture (only after the butter and chocolate mixture have reached room temperature). Mix this well. Add the yogurt and mix. Add the cocoa powder and mix. Add into the flour and baking powder and beat until you see no lumps. Add in half of the mulberries and chopped walnuts and mix. Pour the batter into a greased baking dish. Bake until you can insert a thin stick into the cake and it comes out clean. Top it with vanilla ice cream and more fresh mulberries. Serve it hot. Strawberry Casserole Ingredients: 125 g greek yogurt (or any full-fat yogurt) 125 g cream cheese 60 ml full-fat milk 3 table spoons honey 1 tea spoon vanilla extract 80 g all-purpose flour 40 g granulated sugar A pinch of salt Freshly cut strawberries (could be frozen) Almond flakes (optional) Directions: Preheat the oven to 180°C. Blend together greek yogurt, cream cheese, milk, honey, vanilla extract, flour, sugar and salt until smooth. Line a baking pan with parchment paper. Pour the blended mixture into the lined baking pan. Top the mixture with freshly cut strawberries and sprinkle almond flakes on top. Bake in the preheated oven for 25 to 30 minutes or until the casserole is completely cooked and slightly brown on top. Serve hot, optionally with cold ice cream or a dollop of whipped cream.
